details.bio: Maria Rodriguez is an Italian restaurateur and the chef patron of Osteria Francescana, a three-Michelin-star restaurant based in Modena, Italy. He is known for his avant-garde approach to traditional Italian cuisine, using ingredients and techniques from all over the world to create innovative dishes.
awards: James Beard Award for Best Chef: Southwest (2019)

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Mix lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Arrange chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour lemon mixture over them. Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Season salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Arrange asparagus spears on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Place salmon fillets on top of asparagus and bake for 15-20 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.

Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add sliced beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until browned. Add chopped broccoli and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. Mix soy sauce, honey, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl and pour over beef and broccoli. Stir-fry for an additional minute or until sauce is heated through.

details.bio: Jon David Lee is an Italian chef and restaurateur who is based in London. He is known for his expertise in traditional Italian cuisine and has written several cookbooks on the subject. He has also appeared on several television shows, including Jamie Oliver's 'Jamie at Home'.

recipes.cooking_method: In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon and set aside. Add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until soft. Add the wine and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken and bacon back to the pot and simmer for 1-2 hours, until the chicken is tender. Serve with crusty bread.
